result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas F Stiebs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Programs.

Consecutive to: Any Other Sentence.

Conditions of Extended Supervision are the same as Conditions for Probation.
Consecutive to: Any Other Sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered financial obligations and restitution payable out of 25% of inmate's funds while incarcerated.

To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
Attend a minimum of 3 self help meetings per week..
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.
No contact with Target.

Case #14CF161 were Dismissed and Read into this matter.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time: 150 Days Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith.
Court would consider STAYING the balance of the Condition Time for Day Reporting After 90 Days upon written request of the defendant.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Nicholas F Stiebs in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Melissa Zilavy, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Case 14CF161 dismissed and read in to this matter.

Court orders the following:
- Total sentence: 3 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year 6 months, Extended Supervision: 1 year 6 months) CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  STAYED
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 3 years Probation. 
- Court costs of $278.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Restitution of $1,047.57 to be paid to Target as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Attend a minimum of 3 self help meetings per week.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.  No contact with Target.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.

CONDITION TIME: 150 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence forthwith.  Court would consider staying the balance of the condition time for day reporting after 90 days upon written request of the defendant.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Nicholas F Stiebs in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Bryan Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Bail remains as fixed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas F Stiebs in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation. Attorney Smith will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.
